translated: Praise of the Names of the Dharmadhatu

analyzed: vaṃ kāram vajra sattvam ca vajrāsana sadā āsthitam
translated: The syllable vam is Vajrasattva, always abiding in the vajra seat,

analyzed: vāruṇa maṇḍala vyāpi vairocana namaḥ astu te  /
translated: pervading the mandala of Varuna. Homage to you, Vairocana!

analyzed: akāram ādi svabhāvam ākāśe vyāpitam tathā
translated: The syllable a is the primordial nature, pervading space in the same way,

analyzed: arka nīla samaḥ tejaḥ akṣobhya śrī namaḥ astu te
translated: with the brilliance of the sun and sapphire. Homage to you, Akshobhya Shri!

analyzed: rakāram lakṣmī svabhāvam nānā ratnam anekadhā
translated: The syllable ra is the nature of Lakshmi, in many ways with various jewels,

original: raṃ vyāpitaṃ ca pṛthvīṃ ratnasaṃbhava namo'stu te // //
analyzed: raṃ vyāpitam ca pṛthvīm ratna saṃbhava namaḥ astu te  /
translated: pervading the earth in many ways. Homage to you, Ratnasambhava!

analyzed: akāram asthiram bhāvam padma nāga sama prabham
translated: The syllable a is an unstable state, with the radiance of a lotus and elephant,

analyzed: agni tejaḥ samādhi stham amita ābha namaḥ astu te  /
translated: abiding in the samadhi of the brilliance of fire. Homage to you, Amitabha!

analyzed: akāram tad svabhāvam ca gandhavāha sama prabham
translated: The syllable a is its nature, with the radiance of the wind-god,

analyzed: akāra viśva vajram ca amodha siddhi namaḥ astu te  /
translated: and the universal vajra of the syllable a. Homage to you, Amoghasiddhi!
The syllable dha is the nature of phenomena, the form of the Dharma and Sangha,

original: dhātvaṣṭakaṃ kīrtitaṃ ca dharmadhātu namo'stu te // //
analyzed: dhātu aṣṭakam kīrtitam ca dharmadhātu namaḥ astu te
translated: and is proclaimed as the group of eight elements. Homage to you, Dharmadhatu!

analyzed: sakāram sarva sampattiḥ sarva maṅgalam arthanam
translated: The syllable sa is all accomplishments, the meaning of all auspiciousness,

analyzed: sarva siddhiḥ tvam eva atha siddhi vajra namaḥ astu te
translated: and you alone are all attainments. Homage to you, Siddhi Vajra!
The Praise of the Name of the Glorious Dharmadhatu is complete.
